results.name: Number of prime factors (with multiplicity) shared by A003961(n) and A003973(n): a(n) = bigomega(gcd(A003961(n), sigma(A003961(n)))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := NextPrime[p]^e; g[1] = 1; g[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; a[n_] := PrimeOmega[GCD[(gn = g[n]), DivisorSigma[1, gn]]]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 17 2021 *)
program: A003961(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003961
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 17 2021
